frame.name: Infrastructure
frame.definition:
<def-root>A group of entities exist (as an infrastructure) such that a particular type of <fen>Activity</fen> is either enabled or facilitated. The entities may or may not have been organized specifically for the <fen>Activity</fen>. The infrastructure is constituted by <fen>Resource</fen>s that can be made use of by <fen>User</fen>s, and the infrastructure may be specified for its <fen>Place</fen> or <fen>Possessor</fen>.
<ex>While the <fex name="Possessor">US</fex> <fex name="Activity">transportation</fex> <t><fex name="Infrastructure">infrastructure</fex></t> continues to crumble, competitors in Brazil and Argentina are investing millions to improve their transportation</ex>
<ex>The exacerbated sprawl like growth in the last decades has been a direct result of decisions taken in the creation, boost, and development of <fex name="Resource">highway</fex> <t><fex name="Infrastructure">infrastructure</fex></t>.</ex>
<ex>Mexico's Ministry of Tourism expects to see more than $1.78 billion invested to further develop <fex name="Possessor">the country's</fex> <fex name="Activity">tourism</fex> <t><fex name="Infrastructure">infrastructure</fex></t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Activity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Activity</fen> which is enabled or facilitated by the infrastructure.
<ex>At present, you'll find that Belize has a <fex name="act">travel</fex> <t>infrastructure</t> that's improving but still far from polished.</ex> <ex>As a result , one of the central policy priorities of government has been to strengthen significantly the <fex name="act">academic</fex> <t>infrastructure</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location of the infrastructure.
<ex>Much of the transportation <t>infrastructure</t> <fex name="Place">in the US</fex> was developed when there was no need for private money.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The organization, institution, or individual who owns the infrastructure.
<ex>Increase the value of <fex name="pos">your company's</fex> technology <t>infrastructure</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Resource
FE.definition:
<def-root>The infrastructure may be conceived of as consisting of Resources that can be made use of by Users in performing an Activity.
<ex>Members of the organization can use the <fex name="res">service</fex> <t>infrastructure</t> to perform management tasks.</ex> <ex>It is critical to point out that, while our <fex name="res">highway</fex> <t>infrastructure</t> continues to deteriorate, highway use is on the rise.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: User
FE.definition:
<def-root>The people for whom the infrastructure is designed to be used by. In the cases where the constituent denoting the user also evokes the <fen>Activity</fen>, we annotate this on the second FE layer.
<ex> There are no specific barriers to investment in Bulgaria's <fex name="user">tourist</fex> <t>infrastructure</t> or in the import of products to be used for tourist infrastructure development.</ex> <ex> There are no specific barriers to investment in Bulgaria's <fex name="act">tourist</fex> <t>infrastructure</t> or in the import of products to be used for tourist infrastructure development.</ex> <ex>Our company makes constant use of the vast <t>infrastructure</t> <fex name="user">for businesses</fex> offered by the government.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Infrastructure
FE.definition: <def-root>The collection of entities and/or institutions that help to promote an <fen>Activity</fen> of a public character.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: infrastructure.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the basic facilities, installations, or other components needed for the operation of a system or organization

lexUnit.name: base.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a system that allows for a particular activity to take place.
